hot.translation[0].definitions[0].defini: something that is hot has a high temperature – used about weather, places, food, drink, or objects
hot.translation[0].definitions[0].exampl: It’s so hot in here. Can I open the window?
Be careful, the water’s very hot.
The bar serves hot and cold food.
people who live in hot countries (=where the weather is usually hot)
a scorching hot week in August
The office gets unbearably hot in summer.
He held the metal in the flame until it became white hot.
hot.translation[0].definitions[1].defini: if you feel hot, your body feels hot in a way that is uncomfortable
hot.translation[0].definitions[1].exampl: I was hot and tired after the journey.
The wine made her feel hot.
hot.translation[0].definitions[2].defini: if clothes are hot, they make you feel too hot in a way that is uncomfortable
hot.translation[0].definitions[2].exampl: This sweater’s too hot to wear inside.
hot.translation[0].definitions[3].defini: food that tastes hot has a burning taste because it contains strong spices
hot.translation[0].definitions[4].defini: something or someone that is hot is very popular or fashionable, and everyone wants to use them, see them, buy them etc
hot.translation[0].definitions[4].note.t: be the hottest thing since (sliced bread) (=used about someone or something that is very good and popular, so that everyone wants them)
hot.translation[0].definitions[4].exampl: one of the hottest young directors in Hollywood
Gareth Bale is one of soccer’s hottest properties (=actors or sports players who are very popular).
The movie is going to be this summer’s hot ticket (=an event that is very popular or fashionable, and that everyone wants to go and see).
hot.translation[0].definitions[5].defini: very good, especially in a way that is exciting
hot.translation[0].definitions[5].note.t: be hot shit American English informal not polite (=used about someone or something that people think is very good)
hot.translation[0].definitions[5].exampl: His new film is hot stuff (=very good).
Some of the tracks on the record are great, but others are not so hot.
She’s pretty hot at swimming, too.
hot.translation[0].definitions[6].defini: someone who is hot is very attractive sexually
hot.translation[0].definitions[6].exampl: The girls all think he’s hot stuff.
hot.translation[0].definitions[7].defini: a film, book, photograph etc that is hot is sexually exciting
hot.translation[0].definitions[7].exampl: his hot and steamy first novel
hot.translation[0].definitions[8].defini: a meeting with someone who you feel very attracted to sexually
hot.translation[0].definitions[8].exampl: She has a hot date with Michel.
hot.translation[0].definitions[9].defini: to be sexually attracted to someone
hot.translation[0].definitions[10].defin: difficult or dangerous to deal with
hot.translation[0].definitions[10].examp: If things get too hot (=a situation becomes too difficult or dangerous to deal with), I can always leave.
Wilkinson found his opponent a little too hot to handle (=too difficult to deal with or beat).
The climate was too hot politically to make such radical changes.
hot.translation[0].definitions[11].defin: to become angry – used especially when people get angry in an unreasonable way about something that is not important
hot.translation[0].definitions[11].examp: I don’t understand why people are getting so hot under the collar about it.
hot.translation[0].definitions[12].defin: someone who has a hot temper becomes angry very easily
hot.translation[0].definitions[13].defin: hot news is about very recent events and therefore interesting or exciting
hot.translation[0].definitions[13].examp: Do you want to hear about all the latest hot gossip?
hot.translation[0].definitions[14].defin: following someone quickly and closely because you want to catch them
hot.translation[0].definitions[14].examp: The car sped away, with the police in hot pursuit.
hot.translation[0].definitions[15].defin: close to and likely to catch someone you have been chasing
hot.translation[0].definitions[15].examp: The other car was hot on his tail.
hot.translation[0].definitions[16].examp: Mrs Bass’s dog was already hot on his heels.
hot.translation[0].definitions[17].defin: goods that are hot have been stolen
hot.translation[0].definitions[18].defin: music that is hot has a strong exciting rhythm
